title: What are the physiological responses to M. Donato's contradictory gestures and commands during hypnosis?
first_phrase: The text discusses the Donatist Fas[c]ination, a hypnotic technique used by M. Donato on his subjects. In the previous section, the author explains how Donato establishes his subjects' trust, and now, in the last 200 tokens, he explores how Donato interrupts his subjects' speech and commands them to perform certain actions using gestures. He also explains how Donato's subjects perceive the gestures even with their eyes closed. Furthermore, the text mentions how Donato's subjects are easily convinced to believe and act upon his thoughts and orders. The author suggests that such techniques can lead to altered mental states that can be dangerous if not monitored carefully.

C’est ainsi que la plupart do ceux qui exécutent pour la première fois une charge à la baïonnette, tuant tout devant eux, ont besoin de se reconnaître avant d’ètre capables do se souvenir de leur nom! leur état nerveux est voisin du sommeil étudié par M. De mémo aussi ceux qui, au lieu de regarder en face un magnétiseur, regardent l’abîme et rêvent de changer la face du monde, deviennent, hélas! capables d’un état nerveux pendant lequel ils suivent l'idée qu1 les obsède, en cessant d’ètre des hommes. last_phrase: In conclusion, while the phenomenon observed by M. Donato is fascinating and worthy of scientific attention, it is crucial to remain cautious when encountering similar states of altered consciousness. As mesmerizing as it may be to watch, we must not confuse illusion with reality, and always approach with a critical mindset before fully embracing any new idea.
